_exec_summary.SummaryText: RMP Report for F & Feeds, Inc. Emporia, Kansas - (1)  Facility Policy.  The owners, management and employees of F. & F. Feeds are commited to the prevention of any accidental release of anhydrous ammonia.  If an accidental release should occur,  the facility is prepared to work with the local fire department, Lyon County LEPC, and/or other aurhorities to mitigate and minimize the impacts of the release to the public and the environment.  (2)  Facility information.  The primary activity at this facility is the distribution of products to farmers.  The Fertilizer product, anhydrous ammonia, is received, stored and distributed for direct application as a nutrient for crop production.  Anhydrous ammonia is stored in tanks designed for this purpose. (3)  Accident Release Prevention Program.  This facility follows the provisions of the U. S. Occupational Safety and Health administration (OSHA) 29 CFR 1910.111, "Storage and Handling of Anhydrous Ammonia, and our State Regulations covering anhydrous ammonia.  (4)  Five Year Accident History.  There has been no accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia at this facility during the past five years that caused any injuries, deaths, or significant property damage.  Nor to our knowledge has there been any accidental releases resulting in off-site deaths, injuries, evacuations, property dmage, or environmental damage.  (5)  Emergency Response Program.  This facility has an Emergency Action Plan.  We do not plan to have our employees respond to a major release.  If a large release of anhydrous ammonia should occur at our facility, the reponse action is to evacuate the area of the release and call 911 and other emergency response numbers.  (6)  Planned Changes to Improve Safety.  Safety improvement is an ongoing process at this facility.  Periodic evaluations are performed to assess conditions at the facility.  At this time there are no major changes planned for our safety program.
